page.title: 06Farming in South Clevedon.
page.content: The Baker family own the largest farm in South Clevedon. It covers 2OO acres altogether. The farm is mainly for { {beef and lamb }production with {6OO {ewes and lambs} and {8O head of {cattle.}Only 1O acres is used for growing corn for winter fodder. The biggest major influence on farming policy in recent years was the advent of the {motorway.}Much of the original land and and the farmhouse was bought by the Ministry of Transport. The new farmhouse was built in 197O but due to insufficient compensation the farm was forced to change from being 5O% dairy to 1OO% meat producing. Evidence of the original dairy can be seen, near our school, in the form of a derelict milking parlour. The picture of farming in the area is one of{milk and meat} production. Very few crops are grown.
